page.title: 20HESELTINE CRISIS (CONT.)
page.content: If the development occurred, Warfield's individuality and countryside would be spoilt. The major increase in the volume of traffic would cause problems like pollution. A recent survey showed that 84% of the population chose to spend their leisure time in the countryside. Villages like Warfield and Binfield are a target for developers, rural land being cheaper than central city sites. If this particular area becomes over developed, the villages will merge into Bracknell, losing their friendly atmosphere and so increasing social problems. By continually building in South East England, pressure is put on the depressed Northern areas, so detracting industry from the regions most in need of it.
